mouse.name: Mouse
mouse.description: A computer mouse is a hand-held pointing device that detects two-dimensional motion relative to a surface.
mouse.uses: Used to interact with graphical user interfaces on computers.
mouse.history: Invented in 1964 by Douglas Engelbart at Stanford Research Institute.

keyboard.name: Keyboard
keyboard.description: A keyboard is an input device used to type text and interact with computers.
keyboard.uses: Used for typing and interacting with software.
keyboard.history: Invented in the 1860s as part of the typewriter.

monitor.name: Monitor
monitor.description: A monitor is an output device that displays information in visual form.
monitor.uses: Used to display graphical and textual information from a computer.
monitor.history: The first CRT monitor was invented in 1897 by Karl Ferdinand Braun.

cpu.name: CPU
cpu.description: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is the brain of the computer, responsible for executing instructions.
cpu.uses: Processes instructions and performs calculations for computer operations.
cpu.history: The first microprocessor, the Intel 4004, was invented in 1971 by Federico Faggin and his team.

printer.name: Printer
printer.description: A printer is a peripheral device that produces a hard copy of digital documents.
printer.uses: Used to print documents, images, and other digital content onto paper.
printer.history: The first xerographic printer was invented in 1938 by Chester Carlson.

scanner.name: Scanner
scanner.description: A scanner is a device that captures images from physical documents and converts them into digital formats.
scanner.uses: Used to digitize physical documents, photos, and other media.
scanner.history: The first image scanner was developed in 1957 by Russell A. Kirsch.

motherboard.name: Motherboard
motherboard.description: The motherboard is the main circuit board that connects all components of a computer.
motherboard.uses: Serves as the central hub for communication between the CPU, RAM, storage, and peripherals.
motherboard.history: The first motherboard was introduced in 1981 with the IBM Personal Computer.

hard_drive.name: Hard Drive
hard_drive.description: A hard drive is a data storage device used to store and retrieve digital information.
hard_drive.uses: Used to store operating systems, software, and user data.
hard_drive.history: The first hard drive was introduced by IBM in 1956 and was called the IBM 305 RAMAC.

ram.name: RAM
ram.description: RAM (Random Access Memory) is a type of computer memory that stores data temporarily for quick access.
ram.uses: Used to store data and instructions that the CPU needs to access quickly.
ram.history: The first DRAM (Dynamic RAM) was invented in 1968 by Robert Dennard.

power_supply.name: Power Supply
power_supply.description: The power supply unit (PSU) converts electrical power from an outlet into usable power for a computer.
power_supply.uses: Provides power to all components of a computer.
power_supply.history: The first power supply units were developed for early mainframe computers in the 1950s.

graphics_card.name: Graphics Card
graphics_card.description: A graphics card is a hardware component that renders images, videos, and animations.
graphics_card.uses: Used to process and render graphical data for display on a monitor.
graphics_card.history: The first graphics card was introduced in 1981 with the IBM Monochrome Display Adapter.

soldering_iron.name: Soldering Iron
soldering_iron.description: A soldering iron is a hand tool used to heat solder and join electronic components.
soldering_iron.uses: Used in electronics to solder components onto circuit boards.
soldering_iron.history: The modern electric soldering iron was invented in 1941 by Carl E. Weller.

multimeter.name: Multimeter
multimeter.description: A multimeter is a measuring instrument used to measure voltage, current, and resistance.
multimeter.uses: Used in electronics and electrical work to diagnose and troubleshoot circuits.
multimeter.history: Invented in the 1920s by Donald Macadie, who combined multiple measurement tools into one device.

lathe_machine.name: Lathe Machine
lathe_machine.description: A lathe is a machine tool that rotates a workpiece to perform various operations such as cutting, sanding, and drilling.
lathe_machine.uses: Used in woodworking, metalworking, and manufacturing to shape materials.
lathe_machine.history: The earliest lathes were developed in ancient Egypt around 1300 BC.

drill_press.name: Drill Press
drill_press.description: A drill press is a stationary machine used to drill precise holes in materials.
drill_press.uses: Used in woodworking, metalworking, and construction for drilling holes.
drill_press.history: The first electric drill was patented in 1889 by Arthur James Arnot and William Blanch Brain.

welding_machine.name: Welding Machine
welding_machine.description: A welding machine is a device used to join materials, usually metals or thermoplastics, by applying heat.
welding_machine.uses: Used in construction, manufacturing, and repair work to weld materials together.
welding_machine.history: The first arc welding process was developed in 1881 by Nikolay Benardos.

sewing_machine.name: Sewing Machine
sewing_machine.description: A sewing machine is a device used to stitch fabric and other materials together with thread.
sewing_machine.uses: Used in garment production, tailoring, and crafting.
sewing_machine.history: The first practical sewing machine was invented in 1846 by Elias Howe.

hammer.name: Hammer
hammer.description: A hammer is a hand tool used to deliver impact force to objects like nails or chisels.
hammer.uses: Used in construction, carpentry, and metalworking.
hammer.history: The hammer has been used since prehistoric times, with early versions made of stone.

screwdriver.name: Screwdriver
screwdriver.description: A screwdriver is a hand tool used to turn screws.
screwdriver.uses: Used in construction, electronics, and mechanical work to fasten or loosen screws.
screwdriver.history: The first screwdrivers appeared in the late Middle Ages, around the 15th century.
